message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as cross-lingual retrieval and statistical machine translation. It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the paper discusses a web crawling method for building subject-aligned comparable corpora from Wikipedia articles. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of machine learning techniques for training and adapting a machine translation system, which could place it in the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper's focus on filtering out noisy or just comparable sentence pairs could also make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.DL (Deep Learning).
